9enum
10{
11 Value_Null = 0,
12 Value_Integer,
13 Value_Float,
14 Value_String,
15 Value_Any,
16 Value_Code,
17 Value_Macro,
18 Value_Ident,
19 Value_CString,
20 Value_CAny,
21 Value_Word,
22 Value_Pop,
23 Value_Cond,
24};
25
26enum
27{
28 Id_Var, //1
29 Id_FloatVar,
30 Id_StringVar,
31 Id_Command,
32 Id_Alias, //5
33 Id_Local,
34 Id_Do,
35 Id_DoArgs,
36 Id_If,
37 Id_Result, //10
38 Id_Not,
39 Id_And,
40 Id_Or, //13
41};
42
43enum
44{
45 Idf_Persist = 1<<0,
46 Idf_Override = 1<<1,
47 Idf_Hex = 1<<2,
48 Idf_ReadOnly = 1<<3,
49 Idf_Overridden = 1<<4,
50 Idf_Unknown = 1<<5,
51 Idf_Arg = 1<<6,
52};
53
54struct ident;
55
56struct identval
57{
58 union
59 {
60 int i; // Id_Var, ValueInteger
61 float f; // Id_FloatVar, ValueFloat
62 char *s; // Id_StringVar, ValueString
63 const uint *code; // ValueCode
64 ident *id; // ValueIdent
65 const char *cstr; // ValueCString
66 };
67};
68
69struct tagval : identval
70{
71 int type;
72
73 void setint(int val)
74 {
75 type = Value_Integer;
76 i = val;
77 }
78
79 void setfloat(float val)
80 {
81 type = Value_Float;
82 f = val;
83 }
84
85 void setnumber(double val)
86 {
87 i = static_cast<int>(val);
88 if(val == i)
89 {
90 type = Value_Integer;
91 }
92 else
93 {
94 type = Value_Float;
95 f = val;
96 }
97 }
98
99 void setstr(char *val)
100 {
101 type = Value_String;
102 s = val;
103 }
104
105 void setnull()
106 {
107 type = Value_Null;
108 i = 0;
109 }
110
111 void setcode(const uint *val)
112 {
113 type = Value_Code;
114 code = val;
115 }
116
117 void setmacro(const uint *val)
118 {
119 type = Value_Macro;
120 code = val;
121 }
122
123 void setcstr(const char *val)
124 {
125 type = Value_CString;
126 cstr = val;
127 }
128
129 void setident(ident *val)
130 {
131 type = Value_Ident;
132 id = val;
133 }
134
135 const char *getstr() const;
136 int getint() const;
137 float getfloat() const;
138 double getnumber() const;
139 bool getbool() const;
140 void getval(tagval &r) const;
141
142 void cleanup();
143};
144
145struct identstack
146{
147 identval val;
148 int valtype;
149 identstack *next;
150};
151
152typedef void (__cdecl *identfun)(ident *id);
153
162struct ident
163{
164 //this pointer will point to different types depending upon the type of variable
165 union identvalptr
166 {
167 void *p; // ID_*VAR
168 int *i; // Id_Var
169 float *f; // Id_FloatVar
170 char **s; // Id_StringVar
171 };
172
173 uchar type; // one of ID_* above
174 union
175 {
176 uchar valtype; // Id_Alias
177 uchar numargs; // Id_Command
178 };
179 ushort flags;
180 int index;
181 const char *name;
182 union
183 {
184 struct // Id_Var, Id_FloatVar, Id_StringVar
185 {
186 union //number var range union type
187 {
188 struct
189 {
190 int minval,
191 maxval;
192 }; // Id_Var
193 struct
194 {
195 float minvalf,
196 maxvalf;
197 }; // Id_FloatVar
198 };
199 identvalptr storage;
200 identval overrideval;
201 };
202 struct // Id_Alias
203 {
204 uint *code;
205 identval val;
206 identstack *stack;
207 };
208 struct // Id_Command
209 {
210 const char *args;
211 uint argmask;
212 };
213 };
214 identfun fun; // Id_Var, Id_FloatVar, Id_StringVar, Id_Command
215
216 ident() {}
217 // Id_Var
218 ident(int t, const char *n, int m, int x, int *s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
219 : type(t), flags(flags | (m > x ? Idf_ReadOnly : 0)), name(n), minval(m), maxval(x), fun((identfun)f)
220 { storage.i = s; }
221
222 // Id_FloatVar
223 ident(int t, const char *n, float m, float x, float *s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
224 : type(t), flags(flags | (m > x ? Idf_ReadOnly : 0)), name(n), minvalf(m), maxvalf(x), fun((identfun)f)
225 { storage.f = s; }
226
227 // Id_StringVar
228 ident(int t, const char *n, char **s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
229 : type(t), flags(flags), name(n), fun((identfun)f)
230 { storage.s = s; }
231
232 // Id_Alias
233 ident(int t, const char *n, char *a, int flags)
234 : type(t), valtype(Value_String), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
235 { val.s = a; }
236
237 ident(int t, const char *n, int a, int flags)
238 : type(t), valtype(Value_Integer), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
239 { val.i = a; }
240
241 ident(int t, const char *n, float a, int flags)
242 : type(t), valtype(Value_Float), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
243 { val.f = a; }
244
245 ident(int t, const char *n, int flags)
246 : type(t), valtype(Value_Null), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
247 {}
248 ident(int t, const char *n, const tagval &v, int flags)
249 : type(t), valtype(v.type), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
250 { val = v; }
251
252 // Id_Command
253 ident(int t, const char *n, const char *args, uint argmask, int numargs, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
254 : type(t), numargs(numargs), flags(flags), name(n), args(args), argmask(argmask), fun((identfun)f)
255 {}
256
257 void changed()
258 {
259 if(fun)
260 {
261 fun(this);
262 }
263 }
264
265 void setval(const tagval &v)
266 {
267 valtype = v.type;
268 val = v;
269 }
270
271 void setval(const identstack &v)
272 {
273 valtype = v.valtype;
274 val = v.val;
275 }
276
277 void forcenull()
278 {
279 if(valtype==Value_String)
280 {
281 delete[] val.s;
282 }
283 valtype = Value_Null;
284 }
285
286 float getfloat() const;
287 int getint() const;
288 double getnumber() const;
289 const char *getstr() const;
290 void getval(tagval &r) const;
291 void getcstr(tagval &v) const;
292 void getcval(tagval &v) const;
293};

347inline int parseint(const char *s)
348{
349 return static_cast<int>(strtoul(s, nullptr, 0));
350}

526
527// nasty macros for registering script functions, abuses globals to avoid excessive infrastructure
528
529//* note: many of the VARF comments are very repetitive, because the code itself is nearly duplicated too *//
530
531/* how command registration works:
532 * In C++, all global variables must be initiated before main() is called
533 * Each of these macro kludges (which are placed at the global scope level) initializes some kind of global variable
534 * Because the macro kludges are the definition of global variables, at program initializiation, they must be run first
535 * The values of the variables themselves don't matter because they only exist to cheat and run before main()
536 * The macro kludges themselves register commands or values within some vector<>-s which keeps track of all cmds/vars
537 */
538
539//command macros
540#define KEYWORD(name, type) static bool dummy_##type = addcommand(#name, (identfun)nullptr, nullptr, type)
541#define COMMANDKN(name, type, fun, nargs) static bool dummy_##fun = addcommand(#name, (identfun)fun, nargs, type)
542#define COMMANDK(name, type, nargs) COMMANDKN(name, type, name, nargs)
543#define COMMANDN(name, fun, nargs) COMMANDKN(name, Id_Command, fun, nargs)
544#define COMMAND(name, nargs) COMMANDN(name, name, nargs)
545
546//integer var macros
547//VAR_, _VARF, VARM_ are templates for "normal" macros that do not execute an inline function
548#define VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist)
549#define VARN(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, 0)
550#define VARNP(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
551#define VARNR(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
552#define VAR(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, 0)
553#define VARP(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
554#define VARR(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
555
556//variable with inline function to be executed on change (VARiable with Function = VARF)
557#define VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
558 int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
559
560#define VARFN(name, global, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, 0)
561#define VARF(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, 0)
562#define VARFP(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
563#define VARFR(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Override)
564#define VARFNP(name, global, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
565
566//hexadecimal var macros
567#define HVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist | Idf_Hex)
568#define HVARP(name, min, cur, max) HVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
569
570//hex variable with function to be executed on change (Hexadecimal VARiable with Function = HVARF)
571//the CVAR series of macros borrows the HVARF macro as it deals with hex colors
572#define HVARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
573 int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist | Idf_Hex); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
574
575//color var macros
576#define CVAR_(name, cur, init, body, persist) bvec name = bvec::hexcolor(cur); HVARF_(name, _##name, 0, cur, 0xFFFFFF, { init; name = bvec::hexcolor(_##name); body; }, persist)
577#define CVARP(name, cur) CVAR_(name, cur, , , Idf_Persist)
578#define CVARR(name, cur) CVAR_(name, cur, , , Idf_Override)
579#define CVARFP(name, cur, body) CVAR_(name, cur, , body, Idf_Persist)
580#define CVAR0_(name, cur, body, persist) CVAR_(name, cur, { if(!_##name) _##name = cur; }, body, persist)
581#define CVAR0R(name, cur) CVAR0_(name, cur, , Idf_Override)
582#define CVAR1_(name, cur, body, persist) CVAR_(name, cur, { if(_##name <= 255) _##name |= (_##name<<8) | (_##name<<16); }, body, persist)
583#define CVAR1R(name, cur) CVAR1_(name, cur, , Idf_Override)
584#define CVAR1FR(name, cur, body) CVAR1_(name, cur, body, Idf_Override)
585
586//float var macros
587#define FVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) float global = fvariable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist)
588#define FVARNP(name, global, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
589#define FVAR(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, 0)
590#define FVARP(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
591#define FVARR(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
592
593//float variable with function to be executed on change (Float VARiable with Function = FVARF)
594#define FVARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
595 float global = fvariable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */ \
596
597#define FVARF(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, 0)
598#define FVARFP(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
599#define FVARFR(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Override)
600
601//string var macros
602#define SVAR_(name, global, cur, persist) char *global = svariable(#name, cur, &global, nullptr, persist)
603#define SVAR(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, 0)
604#define SVARP(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, Idf_Persist)
605#define SVARR(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, Idf_Override)
606
607//string variable with function to be executed on change (Float VARiable with Function = FVARF)
608#define SVARF_(name, global, cur, body, persist) \
609 char *global = svariable(#name, cur, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
610
611#define SVARF(name, cur, body) SVARF_(name, name, cur, body, 0)
612#define SVARFR(name, cur, body) SVARF_(name, name, cur, body, Idf_Override)
613
614#endif /* COMMAND_H_ */
